text: Pours a clear pale yellow thick lacing. Aroma is grass, cereal, urine and moderate metal

Can @ Home. Thanks, Ed! Slightly hazed straw colored beer with a dense white head. Very lemon and herb forward hop aroma. Big time grass, too. Crisp pale malts, some white grapefruit, and plenty of biscuit. Theres a nice bit of peach as well. The flavor is much more bitter than I would like, but there is a good bit of biscuit and bready malt in there. Strong citrus pith, pine, and grass.
Drank at a bottle share with my fellow workers! Was expecting more from this, Carton gets alot of hype, but this pale lager, left me wanting more, some more flavor, some more crispness, something...

Bottle at the jredmond tasting in NYC 160326. Hazy pale yellow beer with a decent off-white head. Bready hop aroma, caramel, grapes, citrus notes. Hoppy citrus flavor, pine, grass, bread, some biscuits. Decent beer.

Bottle shared at the Canary wharf tasting 16/02/2016. Light hazed bright yellow coloured pour with a lasting halo white head. Aroma is light gains, pollen, light citrus, floral hop. Flavour is light grains, pils, cereal, clean, floral pollen, citrus hop. Palate is light easy going, highish carbonation. Good premium lager.

16th February 2016Level 42 Tasting. Thanks to Leighton. A very light haze on this paleish gold beer, thin white head. Palate is light and dry and has a fine minerally crispness. Thin pale malts. Light floralness turning mildly bitter. Whisper of citrus. Light semi dry finish. Mild citric peel bitter linger.

Can share at Canary Wharf as Carton Sit Down Son. Many thanks to Leighton.  Pale yellow, clear, still, foamy white head, light lacing. Aroma is cotton, a little mint, airy. Body is light, soft carbonation, a little foamy. Taste is light bready malt, cotton, crackers, a little pine, dry and clean. Quite decent.
Tall can from Bread and Honey. Light gold body with medium head. Nose is hoppy, citrus. Taste is lots of hops and floral and citrus. Prickly texture. Enjoyable.

1 pint can shared at the Level 42 tasting, London. Thanks to Leighton. It pours a clean pale golden color with minimal white head. Aroma is light sweet grains ad starch. Taste is also sweet and crispy with some more starch grains and grass. Light bodied with good carbonation. Overall, ok

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2016 Can thanks to Leighton. It pours lightly hazy yellow with a thick white head. The nose is fresh, juicy, pine needles, grassy, green, white bread and cracker. The taste is soft, bitter, grassy, white bread, cracker, flour, straw, cereal and pine needles with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate, foamy carbonation. Well - rounded and very quaffable. A rather nice lager bier.

Can split at the level 42 tasting, thanks to Leighton, 16/02/16.
Very lightly hazed yellow golden with a decent off white covering.
Nose is lemon drizzle, straw, floral notes, tangerine, sprucey wood.
Taste comprises juicy hop strokes, grain, crackers, tangerine, melon.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a juicy hop whisper.
Solid ... but pale lager me thinks not !!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Can shared in London - big thanks to Sander. Pours clear yellow with a light, creamy white head. The nose has light lemon peel, grapefruit, hay, pine. Light sweet flavor with dry biscuits, light bitter grass, pine, pithy grapefruit. Light bodied with average carbonation. Clean finish, nice dry biscuits, light bitter grass, hay. Drinks real good.

16 oz can. Lemon and grain aroma. Pale malts. Some herbal and floral notes as well, which come out more as it sits in the glass for a few minutes. Pours a mostly clear pale yellowish color with a lasting sheet of white head and fairly heavy lacework. Clean lager flavor with a solid hop presence. Easy drinking. Gets a little dry on the finish. Nicely done.
Can thanks to Gordito. Pours pale yellow/gold, white head. Bready, herbal, grassy, pils(y) aroma. Cracker / bready, orange, cardboard, light/med mouthfeel. OK.

Can. Pours a clear golden yellow with a foamy white head. Aroma of floral, herbal, grass, light citrus, and bread. Flavor followed the nose with lemon, bread, floral, and herbal notes. Pretty light and crisp. Not my favorite style, but not bad. Light and thin body, lively carbonation, and easy slightly dry to end.

Was enticed by the can and hadnt had a carton in awhile. Pale yellow pour electric white head. Nose is grainy and light floral. Tastes of grains, hint of hops florals, touch melon and dough. Light bodied. Its a pale lager true and true but a decent one.

Can shared with Paul. Pours a light orange golden body with thick white head. Mouthfeel is light bodied with notes of light hop, clean malt, soft fresh baked bread, light spice, floral/herbal character and freshness. Nice stuff.

Shared at the 10th Annual Epic & Unusual Beer Tasting, 11/29/15. Hazy pale yellow, thin fizzy offwhite head, good retention. Aroma of toasted bread, citrus, tropical fruits. The taste is toasted and pale malt, dry citrus. Medium bodied, mild lingering bitterness.
Can. Golden pour with white head. Herbal and floral hop aromas, some normal lager notes. Light floral and herbal Flavors, smoothie lager, nothing off.
Can. Straw color with white head. Floral and earthy hops, sweet cereal grain and light citrus. Light body. Pretty good for what it is.

Pours out a pretty pale yellow gold color with a small white head. Aroma is of grass, dough, cereal, light hop bitterness, sticky malt. Taste is much the same, lots of that sticky cereal malt taste of macros, then in creeps some bitterness to give it something. Not something Id go crazy over, but its the style.

Pale straw gold with a touch of mist to it. Herbal dry hopped aroma leaks out fast, tailed with toasted grains, dry honeycomb, and fresh white bread. Lager yeast and floral, herbal bitterness, straightforward and easy. Peppery, brisk, lean flavor with preserved lemons, notebook paper, citrus piths, white bread sugar. Bothersome, insipid sweetness despite the persistent hop pushback. Brittle and papery consistency but theres enough juiciness and herbal tang to keep it bright.

Can. Clear gold. Very light and smooth, not crisp, no bite at all. Some very light lemon, orange, and grass notes. Easy. I like it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Did I really just spend money on this? Smuttynose is going to get a boost in sales from this, but carton is going to be the ones really hurt. Horribly old tasting all around. Hops and malt. Maybe they put natural ice in the can by mistake. Upon another sip. Nope. I would rather a natural ice right now. Sorry guys. You both just messed up making this
Straw, soft doughy/honey sweetness, grassy bitterness, sweet orange, some minerality. Pretty solid, decent amount of flavor for 4%.

Lightly haze pale golden color with a small, white head that left light lacing on the glass. Aroma of toast, vegetal, old malts. Taste of weak malts, light citrus, green apple, low bitterness. Really disappointing. Drank side by side with Stillwater Yacht and it wasnt even a comparison.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2016 Can shared, pours clearish gold with small white head. Light lacing. Aromas and flavor are traditional lager or Pilsner. Some floral malt, grain, light ash, and corn. Light bodied. Tried other batches, not nearly as good as the first. Knocked it down a few pegs

16oz can from Crossroads. Pours a hazy pale yellow color with a finger of frothy white head. Aroma of light grains, lemons, with hints of yeast and floral hops. Taste of grass, grain, and light grapefruit.

Tallboy can from Xroads. WTF???? Basically Ijust spent the same $ that I would spend on a craft 16oz 4pack for something that could pass as PBR. Poured a watery straw body under an ample foamy bright white head. Aroma/flavor of lightly sweet grains, dough, green grapes, paste. Body is slightly fuller than a macro with average carbonation. This beer sucks, rather have a 4pack of PBR for 1/3 the price.
